item.title: 几内亚在修订预算中预计 2025 年经济增长率将达 7.2
item.description: 预算部长法西内特-西拉（Facinet Sylla）表示，几内亚经济预计到2025年底将增长7.2%，略高于最初预测的7%。【原文：Guinea’s economy is expected to grow 7.2% by the end of 2025, slightly above the 7% initially forecast, Budget Minister Facinet Sylla said.】

item.title: 绘制全球经济图表：美联储抑制降息预期
item.description: 北美两个最大经济体的央行行长本周降低了借贷成本，尽管在美国联邦储备委员会和加拿大央行行长抑制了年底前进一步降低借贷成本的预期后，政府债务收益率攀升。【原文：Central bankers in North America’s two largest economies lowered borrowing costs this week, though yields on government debt climbed after the heads of US Federal Reserve and the Bank of Canada damped expectations for further reductions by year-end.】

item.title: 卡尼称加拿大无法立即取消对华关税
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，立即采取行动降低中国对加拿大商品（如油菜籽）征收的关税从来都不是他周五与中国国家主席习近平会晤的现实结果。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said immediate action to reduce Chinese tariffs on Canadian goods such as canola was never a realistic outcome for his Friday meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.】

item.title: 拉弗解释他的著名曲线如何帮助英国
item.description: 你交的税太多了。几乎每个人都是如此。这是阿瑟-拉弗（Arthur Laffer）的观点，他早在 1974 年就绘制了一条曲线，显示了他对税率和税收之间关系的看法，这条曲线现在被称为 "拉弗曲线"。【原文：You are paying too much tax. Pretty much everyone is. That’s the view of Arthur Laffer, the man who, back in 1974, drew the curve showing his take on the relationship between tax rates and tax revenue now known as the Laffer Curve.】

item.title: 黄金周后澳门博彩业收入增长超过预期
item.description: 澳门博彩业收入在 10 月份增长了 15.9%，超过了分析师的预期，因为这个全球最大的博彩中心在中国黄金周假期因恶劣天气而受挫后，玩家人数出现了反弹。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue rose 15.9% in October, exceeding analyst expectations as the world’s biggest gambling hub experienced a rebound in players after China’s Golden Week holiday was foiled by bad weather.】

item.title: 中国终止黄金减税政策，关键金银市场受挫
item.description: 中国正在取消一项长期存在的黄金税收优惠政策，这对世界顶级金银市场之一的消费者来说可能是一个挫折。【原文：China is scrapping a long-standing gold tax incentive in a potential setback for consumers in one of the world’s top bullion markets.】

item.title: 习近平与李在镕将于周六在韩国举行会谈以重建两国关系
item.description: 在首尔向美国靠拢多年之后，中国国家主席习近平将会见韩国新任总统李在明，两国领导人将努力重建两国关系。【原文：China’s President Xi Jinping will meet his new South Korean counterpart Lee Jae Myung as both leaders work to rebuild ties between their two countries, after years of Seoul moving closer to the US.】

item.title: S.尽管有美国关税和假期影响，韩国出口仍保持强劲势头
item.description: 韩国 10 月份的出口出现反弹，原因是对半导体的强劲需求抵消了美国关税和与节假日相关的日历扭曲所带来的拖累，这为应对全球贸易逆风的政策制定者提供了宽慰。【原文：South Korea’s exports rebounded in October as resilient demand for semiconductors outweighed the drag from US tariffs and holiday-related calendar distortions, offering relief for policymakers navigating global trade headwinds.】

item.title: 谷歌和 OpenAI 推动印度数据中心蓬勃发展的交易者指南
item.description: 随着 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌和其他美国科技巨头承诺投入数十亿美元在印度建设人工智能基础设施，投资者正竞相寻找将从这波投资浪潮中获益的本地企业。【原文：As Alphabet Inc.’s Google and other US tech behemoths pledge billions of dollars to build artificial intelligence infrastructure in India, investors are racing to identify local firms set to benefit from the wave of investments.】

item.title: 司法部调查草药公司交易，该公司股价暴涨 46,000
item.description: 美国司法部正在调查一家总部位于香港的传统中药公司的市场波动情况，此前该公司股价曾短暂飙升 46,000%。【原文：The US Department of Justice is probing market volatility at a Hong-Kong based traditional Chinese medicine company after a stock surge briefly made its value soar 46,000%.】

item.title: 梅洛尼领导下的财政修复受到广泛赞誉，意大利前景得到改善
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）推动意大利恢复借贷地位的努力又向前迈进了一步，因为 Scope Ratings 上调了对该国的评级展望。【原文：Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s push to rehabilitate Italy as a borrower just advanced another step as Scope Ratings raised its outlook on the country.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋完成 10 亿美元股份出售
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.首席执行官黄仁勋自 6 月份以来已出售了价值超过 10 亿美元的芯片制造商股票，完成了事先计划好的大规模股票出售。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang has sold more than $1 billion worth of the chipmaker’s shares since June, completing a massive pre-planned stock sale.】

item.title: Alphabet 和亚马逊入股 Anthropic 使利润增长数十亿美元
item.description: Alphabet 公司和亚马逊公司因第三季度利润好于预期而获得了投资者的青睐。这两家公司的盈利都得益于它们在 Anthropic PBC（流行聊天机器人 Claude 的制造商）中所持股份价值的增加。【原文：Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. were rewarded by investors for reporting better-than-expected third-quarter profits. At both companies, earnings were boosted by the increased value of their stakes in Anthropic PBC, maker of the popular Claude chatbot.】

item.title: 美国政府投资组合基金 "旨在高价买入
item.description: 拟议中的基金是否会错过伴随美国股份而出现的首次股票大涨？【原文：Could the proposed fund miss the initial share pop that accompanies a US stake?】

item.title: 美国制裁俄罗斯后，对冲基金逃离看跌石油的押注
item.description: 在美国对俄罗斯最大的石油公司实施制裁，威胁到这个欧佩克+产油国的出口之后，对冲基金削减了布伦特原油的看跌头寸，削减幅度为历史之最，而此时市场正在适应供过于求的现实。【原文：Hedge funds cut their bearish position on Brent crude by the most on record after the US imposed sanctions on Russia’s biggest oil companies, threatening exports from the OPEC+ producer just as the market was adjusting to the reality of oversupply.】

item.title: 大额债券销售后，Meta 上的信用衍生品开始交易
item.description: 本周，允许投资者对 Meta Platforms 公司债券进行押注的衍生品首次开始活跃交易，因为基金经理和银行希望对冲他们对该行业的风险敞口。【原文：Derivatives allowing investors to bet against Meta Platforms Inc.’s bonds began actively trading for the first time this week, as money managers and banks look to hedge their exposure to an industry that has been piling on debt to pay for artificial intelligence investments.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔表示仍主张 12 月降息
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，美国央行应在 12 月举行的下次会议上继续降息，理由是存在招聘持续放缓的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the US central bank should continue cutting interest rates at its next meeting in December, citing the risk of a continued slowdown in hiring.】

item.title: 比尔-格罗斯抛售国债，华尔街直面美联储疑虑
item.description: 华尔街以高位结束了十月。人工智能的乐观情绪、稳健的盈利以及更宽松的金融条件推动股市连续第六个月上涨，而信贷则刚刚实现了三连涨。【原文：Wall Street closed out October on a high. AI optimism, solid earnings, and easier financial conditions lifted stocks to their sixth consecutive month of gains while credit just notched its third straight advance.】

item.title: 侠盗猎车手》工作室在解雇员工后被指破坏工会组织
item.description:
工会称有 30 到 40 人被解雇。Rockstar Games 的母公司称其为 "严重不当行为"。【原文：

Union says between 30 and 40 people were terminated. Rockstar Games’ parent company cites ‘gross misconduct’

】

item.title: 多家银行称聘请 FTI 参与 Braskem 债务谈判
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，由于担心 Braskem SA 公司的债务谈判会影响到该公司最近向贷款方申请的一笔循环贷款的支付，一批银行正在聘请 FTI Consulting Inc 公司担任顾问。【原文：A group of banks is hiring FTI Consulting Inc as an adviser amid concerns that Braskem SA’s debt talks will affect payments on a revolver loan the company recently tapped with the lenders, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大在七国集团倡议中支持 25 个关键矿产项目
item.description: 力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）和新世界石墨公司（Nouveau Monde Graphite Inc.【原文：Rio Tinto Group and Nouveau Monde Graphite Inc. are among more than a dozen companies set to benefit from a Group of Seven initiative to strengthen access to critical minerals.】

item.title: 华尔街繁荣使纽约预算赤字减少 30 亿美元
item.description: 纽约州的预计预算赤字缩小了 30 多亿美元，因为该州预计股市将创下历史新高，华尔街的奖金前景也将有所改善。【原文：New York state’s projected budget deficit narrowed by more than $3 billion, as the state expects a record-breaking stock market and improved outlook for Wall Street bonuses.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚将关键利率维持在 9.25%，通胀前景黯淡
item.description: 哥伦比亚央行在消费者价格跳涨后作出了维持利率的分歧决定，决策者对财政前景恶化和即将提高最低工资感到担忧。【原文：Colombia’s central bank held interest rates in a split decision after consumer prices jumped and policymakers fret about the worsening fiscal outlook and the upcoming hike in the minimum wage.】

item.title: 坦桑尼亚骚乱导致非洲铜矿对华出口中断
item.description: 坦桑尼亚的一个重要出口港口因选举动乱而暂时关闭，导致非洲运往中国的铜矿中断。【原文：African copper shipments to China are being disrupted by the temporary closure of a crucial exporting port in Tanzania following election unrest.】

item.title: 淡水河谷称中国与铁矿石供应商相互依存
item.description: 淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）的一位高层管理人员说，中国不能放弃主要的铁矿石供应商，因为这个世界上最大的原材料买家依赖于外国提供的炼钢原料。【原文：China can’t afford to abandon key iron-ore suppliers because the world’s largest buyer of the raw material is dependent on foreign deliveries of the steelmaking ingredient, according to a top Vale SA executive.】

item.title: 智利外来者约翰内斯-凯泽在总统民意调查中大幅上升并追平卡斯特
item.description: 在 11 月 16 日投票前的最后一次民意调查中，智利自由派总统候选人约翰内斯-凯泽尔（Johannes Kaiser）与右翼竞争对手何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）并驾齐驱，位居第二。【原文：Chile libertarian presidential candidate Johannes Kaiser has pulled even with right-wing rival José Antonio Kast for second place in one of the final polls before the Nov. 16 vote, a surge in support that threatens to upend the race to lead one of Latin America’s richest nations.】

item.title: 被控窃取源代码的量化交易员寻求撤案
item.description: 一名被控窃取定量公司源代码的 Headlands Technologies LLC 前交易员说，他的刑事案件应该被撤销，因为检察官没有充分说明他涉嫌窃取了什么。【原文：A former Headlands Technologies LLC trader charged with stealing the quantitative firm’s source code said his criminal case should be thrown out because prosecutors haven’t adequately specified what he allegedly took.】

item.title: Orange 以 49 亿美元收购 MasOrange 的控制权
item.description: Orange SA 已同意以 49 亿美元的价格收购其西班牙合资企业 MasOrange 的剩余股份，从而使这家法国电信巨头独占其欧洲第二大市场的业务。【原文：Orange SA has agreed to buy out the remaining stake in its Spanish joint venture MasOrange for $4.9 billion, giving the French telecom giant sole ownership of a business in its second-largest European market.】

item.title: 交易员减少 12 月降息押注，美国国债收益率攀升
item.description: 本周国债收益率攀升，因为在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔发出鹰派信号以及美国经济出现复苏迹象后，交易员们缩减了对美联储 12 月降息的预期。【原文：Treasury yields climbed this week as traders scaled back expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut in December following hawkish signals from Chair Jerome Powell and signs of resilience in the US economy.】

item.title: 做空者安德鲁-左称对冲基金在交易调查中向证交会撒谎
item.description: 安德鲁-莱福特（Andrew Left）是因社交媒体帖子交易而被美国起诉的著名做空者，他正在起诉一家总部位于多伦多的对冲基金，指控该基金的高管向联邦调查人员谎报向他支付的款项，以 "自保"。【原文：Andrew Left, the prominent short seller indicted by the US over trading tied to social media posts, is suing a Toronto-based hedge fund, alleging its executives lied to federal investigators about payments made to him in order to “save their own skins.”】
